column2: The Iron Lady is a 2011 British biographical film based on the life of Margaret Thatcher, the longest serving Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of the 20th century.
based on the life of Margaret Thatcher
Thatcher is portrayed primarily by Meryl Streep
She received her 17th Academy Award nomination, and ultimately, the Academy Award for Best Actress, for her portrayal of Thatcher across four decades.
the Academy Award for Best Actress
Golden Globe Awards - Best Actress – Motion Picture Drama - Meryl Streep - Won
The Iron Lady Directed by Phyllida Lloyd
The Iron Lady Produced by Damian Jones
The Iron Lady Written by Abi Morgan
Thatcher's husband, Denis Thatcher, is portrayed by Jim Broadbent
Thatcher's longest-serving cabinet member and eventual deputy, Geoffrey Howe, is portrayed by Anthony Head.
Margaret Thatcher was a conservator UK prime minister between 1979 and 1990
Margaret Thatcher was member of parliament since 1959
Margaret Thatcher was leader of conservator party between 1975 and 1990
Margaret Thatcher was born oct 13 1925 as Margaret Roberts, in Grantham, Lincolnshire UK
Margaret Thatcher wrote book The Downing Street Years (1993)
Margaret Thatcher wrote book The Path to Power (1995)
